content: slip slip knit two slipped stitches together through the back loop ​ ● sts stitches ​ ● w&t wrap and turn ​ ● yo yarn over one stitch increased ​ pattern notes 1 pattern is written for magic loop but is easily adaptable to dpns testers found that sharper needles were ideal for making the bar pattern stitch 2 pattern is written as toe-up with gusset increases and a heel flap for the foot work until piece measures approx 3 25 3 5 4 inches / 8 9 10 cm shorter than desired length if your row gauge is off the gusset and heel turn will be approximately 36 40 44 rnds knit until this many rnds added will result in the desired foot length alternatively knit until you reach the point to work your desired heel 3 to make the cables centered some cables will need to be worked over the last st of one needle and the first st of the other needle when the first st of the round needs to be part of the cable slip it as if to purl from one needle to the other then continue working until you come to the last st of the round and work the c2r when the first st of needle 2 needs to be part of the cable work to the last st of needle 1 then rearrange the sts so that the first st of needle 2 is now on needle 1 then work the c2r when working the stitch pattern part on the leg with the yo k2 pass yo over 2 sts it is best to leave the sts arranged like this so that the first st of the round is at the end of needle 2 and the first st of needle 2 is at the end of needle 1 4 in the first round of the leg you will want to close any gaps left from making the heel flap to do this pick up an extra stitch between needle 2 and needle 1 beginning of round then knit it together with the first st on needle 1 do the same thing between needle 1 and needle 2 5 charts created using stitch fiddle www last st on needle yo k1* twice 4 sts increased round 2 *k1 ktbl k to last two sts on needle ktbl k1* twice repeat rnds 1 and 2 until you have 28 32 36 sts on each needle and 56 64 72 sts total ending
